alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 4:52PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 449 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rains have moved into the Biscayne Bay but allowed for another half an inch to one inch to fall over the already 5 to 8 inches of rainfall from the last night heavy rains. This additional rains will aggravate any ongoing flooding in the area. Therefore, the Flood Advisory will remain in effect until 6 PM EDT this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coral Gables, South Miami, Kendall, The Redland, Pinecrest, Richmond Heights, Zoo Miami, The Crossings, West Perrine, West Kendall, Country Walk, Richmond West, Palmetto Bay, Sunset, Kendale Lakes, The Hammocks, Cutler Bay, Olympia Heights, Glenvar Heights and University Of Miami. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely.
